I wish there was a better solution so that events at Westgate are ended in a more positive note.

We come here quite a bit because I love the Yard House. When we noticed that they had character Wednesday we were really excited. However; summer is probably not the best time for this. Or they need to have a better system too keep kids cool as their splash pad is a joke for the number of kids. I will still come for the Yard House but no more summer events.

What a great location to pre-game! We flew in from Tampa Fl and pre-gamed at Salt. I grew up in Az and had never been to Westgate! There are a lot of things open during game days. I am unsure if anything is open otherwise. There is some shopping around there too.

What a bunch of whiny Southwesterners.  Westgate is a terrific accessory  built to take advantage of the arena and the stadium.  I am sure that the business generated by out of town visitors for games was the motivation, not the few rubles dropped by the pretentious locals who seem to like to complain about everything.  It is what it is supposed to be and serves the purpose well.

Interesting center with lots of shops and food places to choose from, but they aren't open that late.  Came here on a Saturday night and they had a few places that offered night life, but not many people.  The Margaritaville has a nice outdoor seating area and has a live band on Sat nights.  The Saddle Ranch has an interesting way to check your ID through a bouncer, black light and then you have to look up into a camera while they examine you... definitely the first I've ever seen of this.  The inside was interesting... they have a mechanical bull and interesting country music videos playing on their screens.   WCC has a cute water feature/fountain area.

So Westgate has turned off the Big Screens outside here in AZ which forces folks into the restaurants that are charging 100.00 to 1000.00 a person to sit down there.The one for a 1000.00 was advertised by the channel 12 reporter.Hopefully Westgate will struggle after today as the Reporter clearly stated that they were taking advantage

Been here a billion times and this place is good to chill with friends.  Not too great when it's raining, or when it's melting hot, since this place is outdoorsy.    Great place to play Pokemon Go if you're into that stuff, plenty of stops and gyms, and a variety of Pokemons.    A lot of bars and places that serves alcoholic beverages if you into that sort of stuff.  A few great restaurants, and a AMC movie theatre.    This place has a bit of everything.  You can also ride the free shuttle that will take you to the Outlets for some serious shopping.  There's a splash pad for the kiddos, live bands will always play in the evening, a beautiful fountain that dances, occasionally big gatherings or events occurs like bike night or truck night, or whatever night.  Plenty of parking, unless there is a home game happening, then you're screwed.  And lastly the Loo's to do twos...all very clean.  They sure maintain the place well.    Overall an exciting place to go and hang out!

For nightlife Westgate is about as good as it gets on this side of town - and that's just not good enough! It feels like a shopping mall of corporate bars. Seriously, if you are visiting from out of town and you want to have some adult fun - you MUST visit Old Town Scottsdale - the best bars, clubs, restaurants, art and live entertainment. Please don't judge our beloved valley by the west side!

Love this place, when I lived in AZ I would come to this place all the time. Decided to go check it on in the summer when I was in town and it continues to be a great place to go shopping or eat great food with friends or family.
Fun during the winter as they have a mock ice skating rink. Great restaurants, movie theater, bars and even a Dave and Busters.

Wow, this place is massive.  We came to see a concert at the jobing.com arena.  Unfortunately the Cardinal game had ended maybe an hour previously so the two lane entrance we used was jammed and not for the impatient (me).  We had about an hour before the show yet not one restaurant we found had the ability to feed us if they were able to even seat us.  Apparently these places can't handle a rush.  Go figure.  The concert venue was okay, small enough that there aren't many bad seats.    We opted to eat after the show.  No choices outside of the usual cookie-cutter chains.  We made the mistake of eating at Margaritaville for the view of the water fountains.  They had a late-night happy hour with a selection of sliders nachos and such.   I'm going to keep it short and just say that it's not a good choice.  The staff was very friendly and helpful however.

Went ice skating between Christmas and New Year's. It was a pretty small skating rink, but it was a lot of fun! There was also comfy seating around a big Christmas tree and a live band playing oldies like Mustang Sally. It was a very enjoyable evening!

WESTGATE! West Gate has been one of my favorite hangout spots for a long time, since high school! I remember going to the movies at AMC and going to Johnny Rockets for milkshakes all the time. As I got a little older, I started to venture out to the higher end restaurants and bars at West Gate. This proves that West Gate is a place for everyone.  I really like that there's a lot of outdoor seating and tables so you can spend some quality time outdoors. They have a splash pad for the kids too! A lot of times there's events and live music as well.  There's also a great variety of options for drinks and food. There are TONS of restaurants and bars to choose from. Some of my favorite places are: Whiskey Rose, a really fun country bar with great whiskey sours. Bar Louie because $5 dollar (delicious) burger Tuesdays, and Yard House because I can't get away from their Poke nachos. Kabuki also has great deals on cocktails and appetizers during their happy hour.  Some activities that I like to do at West Gate other than eating and drinking is to play arcade games at Dave and Buster's and it is also great ground to play Pokmon Go!  I would say the main reasons I come to Westgate are to catch a movie or to wine and dine. Although, there are other activities you can tend to like painting pottery or getting your nails done.  Make sure to come a little early as parking can be difficult on weekends. You will find a spot, as their parking lot is huge, it just might be bit of a ways out!

Really not that great. It's an odd island of restaurants of average to subpar quality. The Greek place is pretty good, the sushi place is fine, but otherwise I haven't really found anything of note here. Nightlife is also weird, depending on what events they have going on really depends on the crowd. You don't really know if it's going to be a bunch of bikers or high school kids running around.

Watergate. Troopergate. Westgate.  Ugh! Seriously. It's like City Walk in Universal City, CA had an ugly step sister. Like City Walk is Marcia and Westgate is Jan. I mean really people. It's always Marcia, Marcia, Marcia. Well, she was prettier for God's sake. And here in Glendale, we have Jan.... Awkward Bad signage Pedestrian retailers Chain restaurants with UNINSPIRED employees Parking lots arranged by, oh, I don't know, Helen Keller  I thought this might be the reason to lure my snooty CenPho ass to the westside. But. No. Still the only reason to trek up the 101 is still mom and dad in Sun City. And the parking in their driveway is a breeze.
Date night. Girls night. Family night. Game night. Great restaurants, stores and a way to stroll the district. Super nice here. :)

I really like how all the bars/restaraunts are all in one central area.  It also helps that the parking here is great.  It can be kind of dead at times, but if you come after a hockey or football game, this place is rocking.  All the places are only a few years old, and they have some great lights and fountain.  It reminds me a bit of a mini Las Vegas.  Yardhouse is one of my favorite places to eat.  Saddle Ranch and the piano bar place are the best nightlife spots.

It's a modern strip mall. Not very big, but with a few decent restaurants (by Valley standards, not for visitors). It feels like they tried to trend it towards professional 20-30somethings rather than families, but they fell flat.   Everything here is a chain. That's not an indictment of chains in general, but it creates an experience without any personality. It feels overdone.   On the plus side, there's really nothing else there. It's better than nothing.

This is a super shopping and entertainment center that's much like the "riverwalk" or "city walk" places that some cities are setting up as destinations. This place has everything you would need for a successful date night - ice cream shops, restaurants, multi-screen movie theater, shopping (large chains and small one-off's) and what would be complete without excellent beer options!  Parking is good and I noticed a strong security presence of rent-a-cops and actual cops. Perhaps that was because there was an NFL game the next day at the nearby University of Phoenix stadium, but I'm glad that they were there.

Located literally in front of the Gila River Arena is this entertainment district.  Its an area with lots of shops, restaurants, and even a movie theater.  Across from the parking lot is the Tangers outlet mall, hotels and just a 1/4 mile away is the football stadium where the Cardinals play.  We were staying next door at the Renaissance hotel, and came here on a Saturday night when the Ducks were playing the Coyotes.  Before the game, there's festivities for the kids.  After the game, the bars and restaurants were packed full of people, not just fans, eating dinner and enjoying a Saturday night.  They have pretty much any type of food to think of: - BBQ - Japanese - Cajun seafood  - Steaks - Burgers - to junk food, froyo, coffee, and dessert.  Plenty of parking and the places are open late.  Many merchants offer great happy hours during the weeknights.

Good lord, this place was lame on a Saturday. We went around 11:30 a.m. to eat lunch at Moe's Southwest Grill and Which Witch, and afterwards, we wanted to check out the shops. A little after noon, only a handful of shops were open and those were pretty much only the big name shops. Even shops that had signs indicated they should be open, weren't. I don't know anything about retail shopping centers but it seems that Westgate should regulate that. As a result of so many shops being closed, we were bored out of our minds. Our 4 year old probably enjoyed herself the most on the splash pad.   I have been here before for a concert and it gets happening at night around the restaurants. But retail shops, um not so much.

Whenever I'm in Glendale and want to hang out with my galpals and family, this is usually where we end up. And now with Pokmon GO out, this is a great place to farm some Pok balls!  Westgate has it all: bars, restaurants, small eateries, a Dave & Busters, a movie theater, a splashpad for your kids, and some boutiques. Right next door is a huge outdoor outlet mall for all you shopaholics. Parking at Westgate is plentiful and considering the Cardinals arena is here and so is a concert venue, this place can get ridiculously busy.  This is why it's called an Entertainment Disctrict.  All in all, it's a decent place to walk around when you have good company.
It was nice to hang outside by the fountain as the summer begins to reveal itself.  My daughter had a great time playing. Not as much seating but if come prepared you can make it work.

I went to this place in early October 2007.  Only a few stores and restaurants were open, otherwise everything else was still under construction.  The movie theater was really nice.  Not alot of people, big theater, clean.    We'll see how this place will be in a few years.

We usually come to this place on the weekends. But when my hubby is craving for some Japanese foods at Kabuki, we sometimes come twice or 3 times a week haha.  I love the happy vibes and very lively ambiance of this area. Obviously a lot of people loves it here, because this place is always packed. Other than the Phoenix Sports Stadium nearby, which seem to always have fun events going on. There's hotel also,if you come here as visitor and need a place to stay for the night. They have shopping  Centers too on the other side. I love to shop at the Outlet Mall here.  This Entertain Center has a lot to offer. Restaurants,Arcades, shopping places, Nail Salon & Spa, Ice cream and other sweet treats places etc.  If you come here for dinner, as most people do, there's plenty of restaurants to choose from, whatever your craving for the night . Hubby and I loves to dine at Kabuki, our favorite Japanese Restaurant here. Then afterwards we go watch movie at the AMC. There's a lot of fun places to go here, there's Dave & Busters, which is always crowded that both kids and adults love! You can also bowl at Tavern + Bowl, or if you just want to relax and sit, you can go to the park and just listen to the band that's playing on the park or just have a good chat as you cath up with friends and families.  I love this place a lot! It's quite far from where we live, but it's worth the 25 minutes drive ^_^

It's a really cool place to go to for a bite to eat.  There are a variety of places to pick and eat at, from pizza to bar food. Not only that,  but there are places you can grab dessert from including Frozen yogurt, ice cream, and donuts. There are a few small stores around, but not that many. If you are looking for a place to eat it is worth stopping by.

This is a decent enough outdoor mall, with the outlets on one side and the entertainment on the other.  I give them good marks for events that they have such as ice skating and car shows, excluding the obvious hockey and football games.  There are issues with parking during events if you just want to go to the mall.  They want to charge you for parking if you're going to the game, so obviously those people will try to park in the free area... you can imagine how that goes.  Why charge for parking at all if you're going to have free parking right next to it?
